comments.author: kdevel@vogtner.de
comments.text:
User-Agent:       
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110523 Firefox/6.0a1

In order to present an icon to the user FF connects securely to www.mibbit.com when Application preferences for irc/ircs a viewn.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Edit/Preferences/Applications
2. clickt at Content Type-field named "irc" or "ircs"

Actual Results:  
A HTTPS connection to www.mibbit.com (port 443) is opened presumalby in order to fetch a site icon.

Expected Results:  
Do not connect.

comments.raw_text: dist/bin/chrome/en-US/locale/browser-region/region.properties which goes into omni.jar contains the URL assignments.

comments.text:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110531 Firefox/7.0a1

I can also observe issue - not sure though that this represents a bug.

On Windows the icon is present ever since the drop-down menu is displayed.

Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110531 Firefox/7.0a1

comments.creator: george.carstoiu@gmail.com

comments.text: Issue persists in Firefox 28. May be hidden by setting browser.chrome.favicons to false.
comments.creator: kdevel@vogtner.de
comments.raw_text: Issue persists in Firefox 28. May be hidden by setting browser.chrome.favicons to false.

comments.raw_text:
bug 435687. bug 480826.


This also applies to other applications, such as they are connected to:
GET https://mail.google.com/favicon.ico
GET https://add.my.yahoo.com/favicon.ico


We have a policy for it? WONTFIX for it?
